intro: Goniothalamus philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine star orchid, is a member of the Magnoliaceae family and is native to the Philippines. It is a small, evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in lowland and mountainous forest areas. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped flowers that are often white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and elliptical in shape, while its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
